# isEqual(to:) | Apple Developer Documentation

- [ Swift ](/documentation/swift)

- [ Double ](/documentation/swift/double)

- [ isEqual(to:) ](/documentation/swift/double/isequal(to:))

- [ Double ](/documentation/swift/double)

-  isEqual(to:) 

Instance Method# isEqual(to:)

Returns a Boolean value indicating whether this instance is equal to the given value.iOS 8.0+iPadOS 8.0+Mac Catalyst 13.0+macOS 10.10+tvOS 9.0+visionOS 1.0+watchOS 2.0+

```
func isEqual(to other: Double) -> Bool
```

## [ Parameters ](/documentation/swift/double/isequal(to:)#parameters)

`other`The value to compare with this value.

## [Return Value](/documentation/swift/double/isequal(to:)#return-value)

`true` if `other` has the same value as this instance; otherwise, `false`. If either this value or `other` is NaN, the result of this method is `false`.

## [Discussion](/documentation/swift/double/isequal(to:)#discussion)

This method serves as the basis for the equal-to operator (`==`) for floating-point values. When comparing two values with this method, `-0` is equal to `+0`. NaN is not equal to any value, including itself. For example:



```
let x = 15.0
x.isEqual(to: 15.0)
// true
x.isEqual(to: .nan)
// false
Double.nan.isEqual(to: .nan)
// false

```

The `isEqual(to:)` method implements the equality predicate defined by the [IEEE 754 specification](http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/servlet/opac?punumber=4610933).

## [See Also](/documentation/swift/double/isequal(to:)#see-also)
